entry.title: Extracting Data from CSV Files in SAP Cloud Application Studio
entry.content:
Hello everyone!

This blog post will explain how to read/extract a value from a CSV file and upload it into a business object.

Design:

In this example, I have used the custom business object (standard business object will also work) with a node named Item and Attachment Folder dependent object.

 

node Items [0, n]
{
	[AlternativeKey] [Label("Item ID")] element ItemID : ID;
	[Label("Product ID")] element ProductID : ProductInternalID;
	[Label("Quantity")] element Quantity : Quantity;
	[Label("Price")] element Price : Amount;
	association ToProduct to material;
}
[DependentObject(AttachmentFolder)] node Attachment;

 

Screenshot of the CSV file prepared for my upload testing.

I want to perform a data extraction from CSV when an attachment is uploaded and when the user clicks an upload button (custom button). So, a custom action was created with the below logic and bound to the upload button in the UI designer.

 

import ABSL;
import AP.PlatinumEngineering;

if (this.Attachment.IsSet())
{
  if (this.Attachment.Document.Count() != 0)
  {
    var get_first = this.Attachment.Document.GetFirst();
    if (get_first.IsSet())
    {
      var binary = get_first.FileContent.BinaryObject.content; //to get the binary content of csv file
      var to_str = binary.ToString(); //convert the binary content to String
      var xpes_tab: XPEStringTab;
      var all_rows = CSV.Parse(to_str, ",", xpes_tab); //use CSV reuse library to parse each row values from the String
      foreach(var row in all_rows.CSVStringTab)
      {
        var item = this.Items.Create(); //you can also perform CreateMass()
        item.ItemID = row.XPEString.GetByIndex(1); //index will start from 1
        item.ProductID = row.XPEString.GetByIndex(2);
        item.Price.content = row.XPEString.GetByIndex(3);
        item.Price.currencyCode = row.XPEString.GetByIndex(4);
        item.Quantity.content = row.XPEString.GetByIndex(5);
        item.Quantity.unitCode = row.XPEString.GetByIndex(6);
      }
    }
  }
}

 

In the script, I have used the data type XPEStringTab and the CSV library with the Parse function. You can access this data type and library only if you import the PlatinumEngineering namespace.

Important: If we raise any case to SAP support saying the library from PlatinumEngineering is not working, they will not support. Because it is not released for general use like other reuse libraries (Binary, Context, Date, DateTime, Duration, String, etc.).

KBA: 2698916 - Facing Issues while Using SAP Platinum Engineering Libraries - SAP for Me

Blogs: SAP Platinum Engineering Libraries - SAP Community

Let's get back to our design: We have a BO and action script ready already. Bind the action to a button in UI designer. Below is a screenshot for reference.

Testing:

Once all the above steps are completed, upload the CSV to the attachment folder and click on the custom action button. It will parse the csv data and add the values into the item node.

Attachment Folder:

Item Node:

Upload button in the Item node advance list pane will call the custom action which will parse the data.

Notes:

  1. You can read only the binary value of a CSV file and convert it into a string. Not Excel or other format files.
  2. Without using the Platinum Engineering Library also, you can achieve this extract. But then building that parsing logic will be very hard and not understandable easily.

Conclusion:

In my experience, I have never faced any issues with some of the Platinum Engineering libraries like Mail, UserUtils, CurrencyConversion, and TextAnalysis.

It will be very helpful if SAP releases this CSV parsing library official like we have for JSON parsing.

My Other Blogs:

    • Enhancing Form of Standard Business Objects
    • Intelligent Sales Execution in SAP Cloud for Customer
    • Adding Local Image to C4C Workflow E-mail Template
    • Rules and Validations in SAP C4C - SAP Community

Regards,

Abimanyu G

entry.title: Pro-code UI Extension in SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2
entry.content:
One of the most common extension pattern in SAP Sales and Service Cloud Version 2 are UI Mashups. The general guidance on UI Mashups is to use the same identity provider for SAP Sales and Service Cloud Version 2 and the mashup. This way, users will not have to login twice and can directly consume the mashup.

For API Calls towards SAP Sales and Service Cloud Version 2, we recommend to use the SAP BTP Destination service. Using the OAuth2SAMLBearerAssertion allows the extension to retrieve an SAP Sales and Service Cloud Version 2 API Token to do API calls in context of the user. This will ensure the User can only see and manipulate data he is entitled to access. Also the correct user context is used for write requests to ensure a propper audit trail.

Scenario

In this demo scenario we will build an extension to SAP Sales and Service Cloud Version 2, which is displaying all open cases as part of the Account UI. A Sales rep will get an easy overview of all open cases and has the possibility to Escalate cases, where he expects more attention. As part of the scenario we can validate, that the Users is only entitled to see cases in his domain. Also we will see, that the patch requests are done using the correct user.
For this scenario I decided to use a simplified architecture based on the Secure a Basic Node.js App with the Authorization and Trust Management Service XSUAA tutorial. This way we don't need to implement the Authentication logic.

Architecture

Compontens:
  • XSUAA and Approuter: The Authentication of users is done by XSUAA and the Approuter. Wen established a trusted connection between XSUAA and the central IdP (in our case SAP Cloud Identity).
  • NodeJS Service: This service is handling the service requests from the mashup. It ensures the user is authorized to perform the requested actions and does the communication with SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2.
  • Destination Service: The destination service is keeping tenant specific configuration and provides the logic for the OAuth2SAMLBearerAssertion, which will at the end allows to retrieve a user specific authentication token for SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2.
  • SAPUI5 Mashup: For this example we decided on SAPUI5 in combination with the horizon theme. It is also possible to use other UI Frameworks like Angular.

Setup XSUAA and Application Router

The application is secured by two components. The Application Router and XSUAA. The Application Router is handling the authorization and acts as an OAuth Client. The XSUAA is a OAuth Service Provided by SAP BTP.
For a Detailed description, how to use AppRouter and XSUAA please checkout the Secure a Basic Node.js App with the Authorization and Trust Management Service (XSUAA) Tutorial.
 
{
   "xsappname": "case-list",
   "tenant-mode": "dedicated",
   "scopes": [
      {
         "name": "$XSAPPNAME.read",
         "description": "With this scope, USER can read cases."
      },
      {
         "name": "$XSAPPNAME.write",
         "description": "With this scope, USER can write cases."
      }
   ],
   "role-templates": [
      {
         "name": "Viewer",
         "description": "Role to get the list of cases",
         "scope-references": [
            "$XSAPPNAME.read"
         ]
      },
      {
         "name": "Writer",
         "description": "Role to get change cases",
         "scope-references": [
            "$XSAPPNAME.write"
         ]
      }
   ],
   "role-collections": [

 {

 "name": "CaseListViewer",

 "description": "Case List Viewer",

 "role-template-references": [

 "$XSAPPNAME.Viewer"

 ]

 },

 {

 "name": "CaseWriter",

 "description": "Case Writer",

 "role-template-references": [

 "$XSAPPNAME.Writer"

 ]

 }

 ],

 "oauth2-configuration": 

 { 

 "redirect-uris": ["https://approuter-case-list-joek001.cfapps.us10-001.hana.ondemand.com/login/callback"] 

 }

}
security/xs-security.json
The XSUAA configuration is stored in the xs-security.json file. It is describing the available roles. Those roles can be used later to check the general authorization inside the app.
Using the xs-security.json we can create a new XSUAA instance.
 
cf create-service xsuaa application xsuaa-service-tutorial -c security/xs-security.json
The app router is a nodejs application. The configuration is stored ih the xs-app.json file.

 

{
  "routes": [
    {
      "source": "^/cases",
      "target": "/",
      "destination": "cases-destination",
      "csrfProtection": false
    }
  ],
  "cors": [
    {
      "uriPattern": "^/cases1$",
      "allowedOrigin": [
        {
          "host": "my1000335.de1.test.crm.cloud.sap",
          "protocol": "https"
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}
xs-app.json
The CORS related configuration is required to allow write requests as soon as the mashup is embedded into Sales and Service Cloud V2. The hostname needs to be according to your tenant URL.
...
# Application Router
- name: approuter
 path: ./approuter
 routes:
   - route: approuter-case-list-joek001.cfapps.us10-001.hana.ondemand.com
 buildpacks:
   - nodejs_buildpack
 memory: 128M
 services:
 - xsuaa-service
 env:
   destinations: >
     [
       {"name":"cases-destination",
        "url":"https://cases-joek001.cfapps.us10-001.hana.ondemand.com",
        "forwardAuthToken": true}
     ]
   SEND_XFRAMEOPTIONS: false
   COOKIES: "{ \"SameSite\":\"None\" }"
manifest.yml
The manifest.yml file contains the deployment description for the approuter. The destination configuration is pointing towards the application service, we are implementing in one of the next steps. Please check the Cookie and x-frameoptions as they are required as soon as the application is embedded into Sales and Service Cloud.

Setup Destination Service

To make calls to SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2 we need to setup the destination service and bind it to the application server. The setup process for a SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2 Destination is described on help.sap.com.

To consume the destination in an service running on SAP BTP Cloud Foundry Runtime a destination service instance needs to be created inside the related development space.

cf create-service destination lite destination-service

This concludes the BTP setup. We can now focus on the client and server side code.
 

Server Side Code


The sample code is published on github along with the described configurations.

To call the SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2 API via destination service, we are using the @SAP-cloud-sdk/http-client (on nodejs). The http client is handling the communication with the destination service (retrieving the Service URL and a authentication token) and executing the SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2 API call.
 
const response = await client.executeHttpRequest({destinationName: "service-cloud", jwt: req.tokenInfo.getTokenValue()}, { method: 'get', url: `/sap/c4c/api/v1/case-service/cases?$filter=(isIrrelevant%20eq%20null%20or%20isIrrelevant%20eq%20false)%20and%20(account.displayId%20eq%20${accountId})%20and%20(status%20ne%2007)&$orderby=adminData.updatedOn%20desc` });

The client SDK is abstracting a couple of activities.
 

 
  • Retrieving token to call destination service
  • Exchange User Token (`req.tokenInfo.getTokenValue()`) with access token for SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2.
  • Call SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2 API

 

Mashup

For the UI you need to ensure you are using the same IDP than the SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2. As the server side is taking care of the token exchange, there is no destination service specific code required.

Deploy Application Code

The Application Code is deployed as another Cloud Foundry Application, which is referencing the destination and xsuaa service.

 

 

 

 

 

# Product List Application
- name: cases
  path: ./cases
  instances: 1
  memory: 128M
  routes:
  - route: cases-joek001.cfapps.us10-001.hana.ondemand.com
  buildpacks:
  - nodejs_buildpack 
  timeout: 180
  services:
  - xsuaa-service
  - destination-service

# Application Router
...

 

 

 

 

The deployment is done with a simple cf push.

Mashup Setup

Integration the mashup in SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2 is a simple process.

 

  1. Navigate to Settings -> Mashup Authoring and create a mashup. The URL parameter can be directly extracted out of the URL or added later in the Process. It is important to not set any default value for dynamic values.
  2. On the Account Screen it is possible to place the Mashup in Adaptation Mode. While placing the mashup, the dynamic placeholder can be assigned. In case of this example we are using the Account ID.

After we integrated the mashup on the page, we are testing the Mashup. As we are already logged in via the IdP there is no dedicated Login Screen shown. As soon as we are clicking the "Escalate" button, the case is escalated. The change history contains a personal user. Also the case list is filtered based on the access rights of the user.

Summary

In this blog post, we have created an application, which is secured using the application router and XSUAA. We created an Destination for SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2 and used the Destination Service to call the case API. At the end, we tested, that calls to the SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2 API are done on behalf of the Business User and that the correct user is used in the change log.

If we review the steps we have done to build the extension, we observe, that many steps are configurations, which needs to be done once. As soon as the infrastructure is configured, we can simply add more use-cases with low effort. For implementation projects it is now important to consider the infrastructure setup at the beginning of the project. This will allow to react agile on upcoming development needs during the project execution.

Resources

  • Sample Code
  • XSUAA Tutorial

entry.title: Accrual Posting Made Simple with SAP Enterprise Service Management (ESM)
entry.content:
Efficient employee case management is a cornerstone of modern HR and service operations. By integrating SAP Enterprise Service Management (ESM) with SAP WorkZone, organizations can offer employees a seamless self-service experience, empowering them to address their needs while improving operational efficiency.

This blog outlines the process flow for managing employee cases within the ESM-WorkZone integration, detailing each step from case creation to resolution and closure.

Scenario Overview

In today's dynamic business environment, services often span multiple accounting periods, requiring precise accrual postings to maintain financial accuracy. Consider a scenario where:

  1. Service cases are created in SAP Service Cloud  (V2).
  2. Financial transactions, like accrual postings, are automated and processed in SAP S/4HANA.

SAP ESM facilitates this seamless flow, automating calculations, postings, and reconciliations to save time and reduce errors.

Technical Architecture

The integration involves:

  1. SAP Service Cloud (V2): Manages service cases and initiates accrual requests.
  2. SAP Integration Suite: Facilitates real-time data transfer between systems.
  3. SAP S/4HANA: Processes accrual postings and reconciliations.

Below is a high-level architecture diagram:

  • Service Cloud V2 ‚Üí Integration Suite ‚Üí S/4HANA

Key Features of the ESM-WorkZone Integration

  1. Centralized Access:

    • The ESM Self-Service Portal is embedded within SAP WorkZone under the Employee Self-Service (ESS) page.

  2. Knowledge Base Access:

    • Employees can optionally search Knowledge Base (KB) articles for relevant information before creating a case.

  3. Structured Attachments:

    • The system enforces consistent structure for attachments and forms, ensuring all required information is included with the case.

  4. Streamlined Case Creation:

    • Employees can create cases using a pre-configured JE form, making the process intuitive and efficient.

Employee Case Management Process

  • Case Creation: Once employees log into the WorkZone ESS page.The company accountant seamlessly initiates an accrual posting request through the Employee Self-Service widget on the SAP Build Work Zone portal, ensuring all essential details are accurately captured and submitted with ease.

 

 

  • Once an Accountant submits an accrual posting request, the Finance Support Agent receives an instant real-time alert about the new case assignment. This streamlined notification system ensures quick access to the case and enables efficient management, allowing finance teams to respond promptly and maintain smooth operational workflows.

  • The Finance Support Agent carefully examines the details of each newly created case, reviewing key aspects such as case type, employee information, and categorization. This thorough assessment ensures accurate classification, enabling swift and efficient resolution.

  • Leveraging advanced AI capabilities, Finance Support Agents can now access dynamically generated summaries that consolidate essential case details. These intelligent summaries provide a clear, concise overview of critical information, empowering agents to make faster, more informed decisions and deliver efficient resolutions.

  • The Finance Support Agent meticulously reviews the Case Form to ensure all details are accurate and complete. Once verified, they seamlessly process and post the data as a journal entry in SAP S/4HANA, maintaining precise and efficient financial records. This streamlined workflow not only upholds data integrity but also enhances overall operational efficiency in financial management.

  • Once the journal entry is posted, the Finance Support Agent accesses the SAP S/4HANA Journal Entry interface to review and validate the recorded details. This crucial step ensures the accuracy of the data and allows for the swift identification and resolution of any discrepancies.

 

  • When a Journal Entry is posted, the system seamlessly updates the case status to "Completed." This automation streamlines case management, ensuring efficient workflows and accurate case closures.

 

Benefits of ESM-WorkZone Integration

  1. Enhanced Employee Experience:

    • By centralizing access and enabling self-service capabilities, employees can address their concerns without unnecessary delays.

  2. Operational Efficiency:

    • Automation of accrual postings and structured case management reduces manual errors and administrative overhead.

  3. Knowledge Empowerment:

    • Access to the Knowledge Base empowers employees to find answers independently, reducing case volume.

  4. Comprehensive Case Visibility:

    • Integration with SAP WorkZone ensures that employees and agents can track case status in real time.

  5. Compliance and Accuracy:

    • Seamless posting to SAP S/4HANA ensures financial accuracy and compliance with organizational policies.

Real-World Application

Consider an employee needing reimbursement for an approved expense:

  1. The employee logs into WorkZone ESS, searches for relevant KB articles, and submits the JE form with supporting documents.
  2. The case is created in ESM, capturing all necessary details.
  3. HR agents review the case, validate the attachments, and post the accrual to SAP S/4HANA.
  4. The case status is updated in WorkZone, and the employee is notified of the resolution.

This streamlined process ensures transparency, efficiency, and employee satisfaction.

Conclusion

Integrating SAP ESM with WorkZone simplifies employee case management by providing a unified platform for case creation, tracking, and resolution. Whether it‚Äôs troubleshooting common issues, posting accruals, or closing cases, this integration ensures that both employees and HR teams have the tools they need for efficient service delivery.

Ready to transform your employee service operations? Start leveraging the power of SAP ESM and WorkZone today!

entry.title: Keep Your SAP CX Systems Running Like Clockwork with CQC Services
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community! 

If you're working with SAP Customer Experience (CX) solutions, you‚Äôve probably heard about Continuous Quality Check (CQC) services. But what are they really about, and how can they help you? Let‚Äôs break it down in plain language.

What Are CQC Services?

Think of CQC services as a health check for your SAP systems. They‚Äôre designed to make sure everything is running smoothly and to catch potential issues before they become big problems. It‚Äôs like giving your car a tune-up before a long road trip‚Äîbetter safe than sorry, right?

For SAP CX solutions, there are two key CQC services available:

  1. CQC for Business Process Performance Optimization (BPPO): This service is all about making things faster and smoother. It looks at the way your critical business processes run within SAP Sales and Service Cloud and offers advice on how to speed things up and avoid bottlenecks. If your team has ever felt frustrated with slow response times or workflow problems, this service is a game-changer. Note: This service is only available for SAP Sales and Service Cloud.

  2. CQC for Deployment Readiness: Whether you‚Äôre just about to go live with a new system or adding new features, this service ensures you‚Äôre set up for success. It checks your system‚Äôs configuration and analyzes things like security, performance, and stability. This service supports a wide range of SAP CX solutions‚Äîfrom SAP Sales and Service Cloud to SAP Commerce Cloud, SAP Customer Data Cloud, and SAP Emarsys. It‚Äôs like having an expert double-check everything before you flip the switch.

Why Should You Care?

Implementing or optimizing SAP systems can be a complex process, and nobody wants surprises during go-live or day-to-day operations. These CQC services give you peace of mind by catching potential issues early and providing actionable recommendations.

Here‚Äôs what you‚Äôll get:

  • A detailed analysis of your system.

  • Practical tips to fix issues and improve performance.

  • Recommendations aligned with SAP‚Äôs best practices.

When to Use These Services

Not sure when to book a CQC? Here‚Äôs a quick guide:

  • CQC for BPPO: Use this when your system‚Äôs performance isn‚Äôt meeting expectations or when you‚Äôre handling complex processes that require fine-tuning.

  • CQC for Deployment Readiness: Book this before going live with a new implementation, adding new features, or as a health check for existing systems.

How to Get Started

Requesting a CQC service is simple. Just log in to the SAP for Me portal and select ‚ÄúContinuous Quality Check & Improvement Services‚Äù under the support options. Pro tip: SAP recommends booking the service about six weeks before your go-live date to ensure there‚Äôs enough time to make adjustments.

For more details, check out the next info sheet:

 

CQC ServiceSAP Sales & Service Cloud (C4C)SAP Sales & Service Cloud v2SAP Commerce CloudSAP Emarsys
CQC for Deployment ReadinessInfo Sheet Info Sheet Info Sheet Info Sheet 
CQC for Business Process OptimizationInfo Sheet ---

 

Final Thoughts

At the end of the day, SAP‚Äôs CQC services for CX solutions are about making your life easier. Whether it‚Äôs optimizing performance or ensuring a smooth deployment, these services help you stay ahead of the game. So, why not give your SAP systems the care they deserve?


Easy steps, amazing CX!

entry.title: Stay Certified with SAP Learning
entry.content:
How long is my certification valid?

Because SAP products evolve rapidly, as of April 2024, everyone with an SAP Certification needs to keep their skills and certification valid by completing mandatory yearly assessments.

You need an active SAP Learning Hub subscription to take the short assessment to stay certified. You can access preparation material and take the assessment at any time.

SAP Certifications are valid for one year. If your certification was issued before April 2024, it will expire on March 31, 2025.

Follow these steps to stay certified

  1. Get an SAP Universal ID - Make sure you have a valid SAP Universal ID with at least two email accounts assigned to it.
  2. SAP Learning Hub subscription - Ensure you have an SAP Learning Hub subscription to access the assessment to stay certified. If you have no subscription, you‚Äôll need to book and retake the full 2-3 hour SAP Certification exam every year.
  3. Check your certification status - Log in to My Learning to see your certifications and their expiration dates. Make sure you complete the short annual assessment as soon as possible to extend the validity of your certification by 12 months. If the certification has been retired and you want to retain your certified status, you need to re-certify in an alternative certification. Find recommended alternatives using the SAP Certification finder.
  4. Prepare for the assessment - Find preparation courses or live sessions linked under your certification.
  5. Take the assessment - The assessment is a short, non-proctored quiz with unlimited attempts. Once you‚Äôve completed it successfully, the validity of your certification will be extended by 12 months.
  6. Congratulations - After completing the assessment with the status of approved, click on ‚ÄúVerify course completion‚Äù, then it will be confirmed that you have completed the process to remain certified. In my case, 1 day after completing the assessment, the certification renewal date was updated for another 12 months in SAP Learning and Credly.

I hope this blog has helped you renew your SAP certification.

If you found this blog useful, please like, follow and share your knowledge.

Feel free to leave your comment or ask any questions related to the topic.

entry.title: SAP Sales Cloud V2 & S/4HANA: Streamlining Opportunity Management & Order Fulfillment
entry.content:
Introduction

SAP offers a robust suite of tools to streamline sales and service operations. From upselling and lead management to automated order processing and post-delivery service management, SAP provides an end-to-end solution that enhances efficiency and customer satisfaction. This blog explores key features and integrations that drive seamless business processes.

A Short Story: Transforming Sales with SAP

John, a sales manager at TechSolutions Inc., faced challenges in managing leads, generating accurate quotations, and ensuring timely order fulfillment. His team often struggled with manual data entry, delayed pricing approvals, and service inefficiencies.

After implementing SAP‚Äôs Sales and Service Cloud integrated with S/4HANA, John‚Äôs team saw a transformation. AI-driven Opportunity Scores helped them focus on high-potential deals, while Product Recommendations streamlined upselling. Automated Quotation Management with Price Simulation and ATP Check reduced errors and improved customer confidence. Once an order was placed, S/4HANA Solution Orders ensured seamless coordination between products and services. Automated Delivery and Billing accelerated order processing, and post-sales support was effortlessly handled through S/4HANA Service Orders.

With SAP, John‚Äôs team increased sales efficiency, reduced turnaround times, and enhanced customer satisfaction. Now, they can focus on growing the business instead of handling repetitive tasks.

Upselling and Lead/Opportunity Creation

1. Opportunity Score, Playbook & Opportunity Summary

SAP Sales and Service Cloud leverages AI-driven Opportunity Scores to help sales teams prioritize deals. The Playbook feature offers guided selling strategies, ensuring best practices are followed. The Opportunity Summary consolidates crucial insights, enabling data-driven decision-making.

 

Quotation and Order Creation

1. Quotation + Price Simulation + ATP Check

SAP facilitates accurate Quotation Management by incorporating Price Simulation and Available-to-Promise (ATP) Check. These features help validate pricing strategies and ensure product availability before finalizing a sale.

 

 

2. S/4HANA Solution Order

S/4HANA Solution Order enables businesses to combine products and services into a single transaction, offering a unified and flexible sales approach. This ensures seamless coordination between different sales components.

3. S/4HANA Sales Order

A Sales Order in S/4HANA ensures accurate order processing, tax calculations, and stock validation in real time. This reduces manual intervention and accelerates order fulfillment.

4. S/4HC - Automated Delivery and Billing

With SAP S/4HANA Cloud (S/4HC), businesses can automate delivery and billing, ensuring timely invoicing and seamless logistics operations. This automation minimizes errors and enhances the customer experience.

 

Key Benefits of SAP's Integrated Sales and Service Solutions

  • ‚úî Real-Time Insights ‚Äì AI-driven analytics and scoring improve decision-making.
  • ‚úî Automation & Efficiency ‚Äì Automated workflows reduce manual errors and accelerate processes.
  • ‚úî Seamless Integration ‚Äì End-to-end integration between sales, delivery, and service ensures continuity.
  • ‚úî Enhanced Customer Experience ‚Äì Proactive engagement and personalized recommendations drive satisfaction.

Conclusion

SAP‚Äôs comprehensive ecosystem enhances sales performance, order processing, and service management through automation, AI-driven insights, and seamless integrations. By leveraging these advanced capabilities, businesses can boost revenue, streamline operations, and deliver a superior customer experience.

Embrace SAP‚Äôs intelligent sales and service solutions today and stay ahead in the digital transformation journey!

entry.title: SAP Sales & Service Cloud v2 + ESM - Token Based Authentication (Avoid BasicAuth protocol)
entry.content:
Token-based authentication is essential for several reasons, especially in today's technology with SAP BTP Integrations, SAP Build for web and mobile applications . Here are some key benefits:

  1. Security: Tokens are more secure than traditional session-based authentication. They are typically short-lived and can be easily revoked if compromised. This reduces the risk of unauthorized access.

  2. Scalability: Token-based authentication is stateless, meaning the server does not need to store session information. This makes it easier to scale applications horizontally, as each request is self-contained.

  3. Flexibility: Tokens can be used across different domains and services, enabling single sign-on (SSO) and integration with third-party services. This is particularly useful in microservices architectures.

  4. Performance: Since tokens are self-contained and do not require server-side session storage, they can improve the performance of your application by reducing the load on the server.

  5. User Experience: Tokens can be stored on the client side (e.g., in local storage or cookies), allowing users to remain authenticated across multiple sessions and devices without needing to log in repeatedly.

  6. SAP Build Apps, Side by Side Extensions and API Integration: Token-based authentication is well-suited for various business use cases for designing extensions for web, mobile applications and APIs, where maintaining server-side sessions is impractical. Tokens can be easily included in HTTP headers for secure communication

Note : SSC V2 Currently only REST is supported.  No Odata APIs are existed today

entry.title: Compensation Complaint via SAP Enterprise Service Management (ESM)
entry.content:
In every organization, maintaining fairness, transparency, and trust is critical‚Äîespecially when it comes to employee recognition and compensation. A recent employee grievance case within our company underscores the importance of clear communication, accountability, and structured resolution mechanisms. Here‚Äôs how a complex bonus compensation dispute was resolved effectively, with both empathy and procedural integrity.

The Background

At the close of the previous year, an employee stepped up during a colleague's extended leave of absence, taking on significant additional responsibilities. The employee‚Äôs then-manager, recognizing the extra workload and outstanding performance, acknowledged this effort through an email promising a bonus reward.

Unfortunately, the manager left the company before the bonus could be processed.

The Dispute

During the annual performance review, the new manager‚Äîunaware of the prior agreement‚Äîstated that the employee‚Äôs current pay grade did not entitle them to a bonus. He further asserted that he was not obligated to honor commitments made by his predecessor. The employee, feeling this was unjust, attempted to resolve the matter informally but received no resolution.

Feeling unheard and unsupported, the employee submitted a formal grievance, citing the unfulfilled bonus promise as a case of unfair treatment.

Step by Step:

Self-service Engagement: The employee raised a grievance regarding the unawarded bonus by submitting a case through the Employee Self-Service portal on WorkZone.

Access Notification to Open Case: The HR receives a notification about a newly submitted grievance case from the employee.

Get support through our Knowledge Base, powered by eGain:The HR Agent consults the eGain Knowledge Base, which the system automatically recommends, to access relevant information and support efficient case resolution where HR can KB via email

Resolution Room with Employee, Manager and Advisory Team: The HR schedules a meeting with the employee, Manager and Advisory in the resolution room to discuss the case.

Update Notes with Resolution Summary: The HR Agent updates the notes with a resolution summary to ensure details are recorded for future reference.

eSignature Request via DocuSign

Closing Case: Successful Resolution: Once the employee completes the eSignature, the system automatically updates the case status to 'Completed,' facilitating smoother case management and ensuring proper closure.

 Outcome

Once all agreed actions were completed‚Äîdocumented, signed, and implemented‚Äîthe grievance case was marked automatically as completed in the system. The employee felt heard and valued, while the manager was aligned with corporate protocols going forward. Most importantly, the process upheld the integrity of prior management commitments, reinforcing the organization's commitment to fairness and accountability.

entry.title: Optimizing Financial Services with AI: A Seamless Invoice Inquiry Resolution Journey
entry.content:
In the dynamic world of finance operations, managing supplier communications efficiently is crucial to maintaining trust and transparency. With the integration of AI-powered tools, finance teams are now better equipped to handle invoice inquiries with speed and precision. Here's how AI transforms a typical overdue invoice inquiry into a seamless, intelligent support experience.

üîëKey Capabilities

Here are the core capabilities enabled by Generative AI in SAP Enterprise Service Management:

Capability Description
Business Information ExtractionExtracts structured data (like Invoice ID, Order Number) from unstructured inputs such as email subject and body.
Document ExtractionParses structured data from PDF/image attachments (e.g., invoices, checks) using AI-trained schemas.
Document ClassificationAutomatically categorizes documents based on predefined classes (e.g., Invoice, PO, Receipt).
Auto-Executable ExtractionAutomatically extracts and populates fields in the business document tab without agent intervention.
Semantic Business Document TypesMaps extracted data to meaningful backend business entities (Invoice, Order, Request).
Integration with SAP S/4HANAEnables real-time lookup, validation, and posting of documents to SAP S/4HANA and other systems.
Prompt-Based AI GuidanceCustom scenario and schema prompts to enhance extraction precision.

‚úÖPrerequisites

Before implementing these capabilities, ensure the following components and configurations are in place:

Technical Prerequisites

Requirement Description
SAP Service Cloud V2 / SAP Enterprise Service ManagementEnsure the latest release is in use.
SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP)For workflow, AI core models, and integration runtime.
SAP Integration Suite (CPI)To connect SAP Service Cloud V2 with SAP S/4HANA or external systems.

Functional Prerequisites

  • Enabled Case Management module.

  • Defined Case Types and Business Document Types.

  • Prepared Sample Documents (emails, invoices) for schema/scenario training.

üß† Architecture Overview

 

üì©Invoice Inquiry Email Initiation

It all begins with a supplier noticing an overdue invoice. Seeking clarification, the supplier sends an email to the finance team, including the invoice number and an attachment of the original invoice document. This initiates a service journey that blends human expertise with AI-driven support.

 

üö®Real-Time Access Notification to Open a Case

As soon as the email is received, the Finance Support Agent gets an automated alert indicating a new case assignment. This real-time notification ensures that no inquiry falls through the cracks and that agents can respond promptly, improving overall service responsiveness.

 

üóÇÔ∏è Verifying and Categorizing the Case

The Finance Support Agent accesses the case, reviewing essential metadata such as:

  • Subject
  • Case Type
  • Supplier Name
  • Status
  • Priority

Thanks to intelligent workflows, even newly onboarded agents can consistently classify and prioritize cases, laying the groundwork for a standardized and scalable support process.

üß† AI-Generated Case Summary

To reduce manual effort and ensure nothing is missed, an AI engine generates a concise summary of the case. This summary consolidates all relevant data points‚Äîinvoice number, supplier, query type, and more‚Äîhelping the agent quickly understand the context and make faster decisions.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

üîçAI-Driven Invoice Data Extraction

The agent leverages AI-based data extraction tools to identify and analyze the details within the attached invoice. These technologies reduce the need for manual data entry and ensure accuracy when verifying key information such as:

  • Invoice number
  • Amount
  • Due date
  • Payment status

 

‚úâÔ∏èAI-Powered Email Drafting

Using an AI email assistant, the Finance Support Agent crafts a clear, professional response. The email outlines the blocked status, explains the missing items, and requests the delivery of the remaining widgets. It also confirms that payment will be processed upon receipt of the full order.

‚úÖResolution and Case Closure

Once the supplier receives the response and acknowledges the resolution path, the agent updates the case status to "Completed." The entire process‚Äîfrom inquiry to resolution‚Äîdemonstrates the power of AI-enhanced workflows in accelerating and improving financial support services.

üí°Key Takeaways

  • Real-time alerts drive faster case initiation.
  • AI-generated summaries speed up decision-making.
  • Data extraction tools ensure accurate invoice validation.
  • AI email drafting simplifies professional communication.
  • Standardized workflows ensure consistent case handling.

üöÄThe Future of Finance Support with SAP

This scenario showcases how SAP solutions integrated with AI capabilities can optimize finance support operations. By automating repetitive tasks, offering intelligent insights, and streamlining communications, finance teams can deliver exceptional supplier experiences‚Äîall while maintaining operational efficiency.

Settings for AI scenarios

Generative AI Scenarios --> Business Information Extraction

Step 1 ‚Äì Define Input Sources
Identify if the case input will come from subject, description, or attachments. Choose based on where relevant information (e.g., invoice number) is typically found.

Step 2 ‚Äì Configure a Business Information Extraction Scenario
If using subject/description, define a scenario and extraction elements (like Invoice ID). This guides the language model to extract info from free text.

 

Step 3 ‚Äì Configure a Document Extraction Schema
If attachments are used, create a schema with header fields and descriptions. This enables structured extraction from documents like checks or invoices.

 

Step 4 ‚Äì Create a Business Document Type
Define a document type with relevant columns (e.g., Invoice ID, Status). Columns pull data from extraction or backend API and allow manual entry if needed.

entry.title: üåüUnlock Insights Instantly: How to Configure KPI Cards in SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2
entry.content:
Keeping track of performance metrics shouldn't require navigating across multiple apps or digging into reports. With SAP‚Äôs KPI Cards on the Home Page, administrators can now offer end-users a personalized dashboard that pulls real-time data from various applications‚Äîright at their fingertips.

In this blog, we‚Äôll walk through how you, as an administrator, can create and configure KPI cards to help your users stay focused on what truly matters.

üéØWhy KPI Cards?

KPI (Key Performance Indicator) Cards give users a quick snapshot of essential metrics like sales Quotes  and opportunities. These cards are highly configurable and serve as visual indicators to drive data-informed decisions.

üîßPrerequisite: Enable the KPI Cards Feature

Before you start, make sure KPI Cards are enabled in your system.

üìåHow to enable:
Raise a case under the component CEC-CRM-PM-PF with the subject:"Enable Creation of KPI Cards" 

üß≠ Step-by-Step: Create Your KPI Cards

Once the feature is enabled, here‚Äôs how to set up KPI cards on your SAP Home Page:

  1. üè†Enter Adaptation Mode

    • Navigate to your Home Page.
    • Open the User Menu and select Start Adaptation.
    • An orange bar will appear at the top, indicating that you're now in adaptation mode.

  2. üß© Access the Card Editor

    • Hover over the border of the My Cards section.
    • Click the pencil icon (Edit) to open the Create Cards pop-up.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

  • ‚ûïSelect a New KPI Card ‚Äì Click on the ‚Äú+‚Äù (Create Card) button to start creating a new KPI card.
  • üß≠ Access Tools and Applications ‚Äì Once selected, the "Tools and Applications" section will appear.
  • üìÇChoose Application ‚Äì From the list, select the application that contains the data source for your KPI.

 

  • üìäView Card Types ‚Äì You will now see options for Standard Cards and KPI Cards.
  • ‚úÖSelect KPI Cards ‚Äì From these, choose ‚ÄúKPI Cards‚Äù to start configuring a performance metric card.

 

 

  • ‚ûïAdd Available KPI Cards ‚Äì You‚Äôll now see available options like Leads and Quotes under the KPI Cards section.
  • üñ±Ô∏è Click the ‚Äú+‚Äù Button ‚Äì Select the cards you want to add by clicking the ‚Äú+‚Äù icon next to each, then click Apply to confirm.

 

 

  • ‚úèÔ∏èCustomize the KPI Card ‚Äì Hover over the newly added card and click the pencil icon to edit.
  • ‚öôÔ∏èEdit KPI Card Settings ‚Äì In the Edit KPI Card dialog:
  • üîΩUse the Saved Filters dropdown to apply a predefined filter.
  • üìäSelect the relevant metric from the KPI Fields dropdown.
  • üìàChoose your preferred Graph Type (e.g., bar, line, donut, etc.).
  • üíæSave Configuration ‚Äì Click Apply to save your customized KPI card setup.

  • üö™Exit Adaptation Mode ‚Äì Once all configurations are complete, click End Session to exit adaptation mode.
  • üè†View Your Dashboard ‚Äì Your personalized KPI card is now live and visible on your SAP Home Page for real-time insights.

üß© Use Cases

  • üë®‚ÄçüíºSales Managers ‚Äì Easily track pipeline performance and conversion metrics in real-time.
  • üõ†Ô∏è Support Leads ‚Äì Monitor open ticket volumes, resolution times, and service efficiency at a glance.
  • üìäExecutives ‚Äì Instantly view top-level KPIs like revenue, growth, or customer satisfaction on the homepage.

‚úÖFinal Thoughts

With just a few clicks, you can transform the SAP Home Page into a personalized dashboard that surfaces critical metrics for your team or organization. Whether you're focused on operational performance, customer service, or sales growth, KPI Cards offer a clean, visual, and customizable way to stay informed.

entry.title: Bringing AI to SAP: Integrating Amazon Connect Q into Service Cloud V2
entry.content:
SAP Service Cloud offers seamless Computer Telephony Integration (CTI) capabilities, enabling agents to connect directly with contact center platforms like Amazon Connect. In this blog, we'll walk through the steps to configure the CTI adapter in SAP Service Cloud and validate the integration end-to-end.

 

Prerequisites: Amazon Connect Details Required from AWS Team

To successfully integrate Amazon Connect with SAP Service Cloud using the CTI adapter, please collect the following details from the AWS (Amazon Connect) team:

1. Amazon Connect CloudFront URL

  1. Example: https://d23xxxxxxx.cloudfront.net
  2. Purpose: Used in SAP CTI configuration as the Provider URL.
  3. This CloudFront distribution must be configured to host the CCP (Contact Control Panel) for Amazon Connect.

2. Agent Credentials (for Testing)

  1. AgentUserNameParam
  2. AgentPasswordParam
  3. These credentials are required to log in to the softphone widget within SAP Service Cloud.

3. Trusted Origin Domain (for SAP)

  1. SAP Service Cloud domain (e.g., myxxxxx.crm.ondemand.com) should be added as a trusted origin in the Amazon Connect instance settings.

4. Contact Flow Setup (Optional but Recommended)

  1. The contact flow configured to route incoming calls to the right agent queue.
  2. Helps simulate real call scenarios during testing.

5. User/Agent Setup Confirmation

  1. Confirm that the test agent is assigned to the correct routing profile and queue in Amazon Connect.
  2. This ensures the call is delivered properly to the agent via the embedded widget.

6. Call Recording and Transcript Configuration (Optional)

Ensure that call recording and transcript features are enabled in Amazon Connect to leverage the Phone Transcript Summary in SAP Service Cloud.

Step 1: Configure the CTI Adapter

  1. Log in to SAP Service Cloud.
  2. Click on the user icon (top-right corner) and select Settings.
  3. Navigate to All Settings ‚Üí CTI Configuration.
  4. Choose Amazon Connect as the communication provider.
  5. Enter the Amazon Connect CloudFront distribution URL (e.g., https://d23xxxxxxx.cloudfront.net) in the Provider URL field.

Step 2: Adjust Content Security Policies

To ensure the CloudFront domain is trusted by SAP Service Cloud:

  1. Go to Settings ‚Üí Content Security Policy Settings.
  2. Add the CloudFront domain (e.g., d23xxxxxxx.cloudfront.net) under all relevant sections to whitelist it.

Step 3: Validate the End-to-End Integration

  1. Log in to SAP Service Cloud.
  2. Click the CTI-Widget icon in the top-right corner.
  3. The Amazon Connect softphone should appear on the right panel, prompting you to log in.
  4. Enter the credentials (AgentUserNameParam and AgentPasswordParam) configured during the Amazon CDK deployment.
  5. After logging in, close the popup and refresh the page if needed.
  6. Set the agent status to Available in the softphone panel.

Step 4: Simulate an Incoming Call

  • Customer interacts with the website through the chatbot, the system automatically captures the engagement and logs it in the contact‚Äôs interaction history. This ensures a unified and comprehensive view of all customer touchpoints across channels.

  • The agent accepts incoming requests initiated by Chatbot and agent desktop will open automatically 

  • Interaction Between Agent and Customer

  • The agent's desktop will automatically save the transcript you can filter the interactions with chat 

  • When we click on the chat, it navigates to Amazon, where all chat interactions are stored, and an AI-generated summary is automatically created

 

Step 5: Complete the Call and Review Transcripts

  1. Once the call concludes, click Close Contact in the softphone panel.
  2. Refresh the timeline to view a new entry labeled Phone Transcript Summary (note: this may take a few minutes to appear).
  3. Click on the Phone Transcript entry to open a detailed view containing:
    • Call details and summary
    • Conversational analytics
    • Customer sentiment and talk time
    • Call recording
    • Full transcript with sentiment analysis

This configuration empowers customer service agents to efficiently handle calls directly within SAP Service Cloud, enhancing the customer experience with real-time insights and automation.

entry.title: Empowering SAP Service Cloud V2 with OpenText: Seamless Integration for Document Management
entry.content:
In today's digital-first customer service landscape, managing documents efficiently is crucial for ensuring speed, compliance, and seamless service delivery. SAP Service Cloud V2 now supports powerful integration with OpenText, enabling agents to securely manage, store, and retrieve customer documents within a single interface. This blog outlines the key steps to configure OpenText with SAP Service Cloud V2 and highlights how the integration streamlines customer interactions.

üìå Why OpenText + SAP Service Cloud V2?

The integration enables organizations to:

  • Centralize document storage and access directly within SAP.
  • Ensure compliance with data governance and retention policies.
  • Provide agents with a 360¬∞ view of customer interactions‚Äîincluding documents, cases, and correspondence.
  • Automate document capture, archiving, and retrieval processe

üîß Prerequisites: What You Need Before Integration

Before starting the configuration, ensure you have the following:

OpenText Extended Account Access

  • Administrator credentials to access the OpenText .
  • API and endpoint URLs.

SAP Service Cloud V2 Tenant Details

  • V2 instance with admin access.
  • Role-based authorization to manage integration settings.

OpenText Endpoint (Base URL) for Mashup

  • Example: https://contentserver.opentext.example.com
    Purpose: This acts as the destination for all document management operations.

Authentication Credentials (for Testing)

  • Username: <OpenTextUser>
  • Password: <OpenTextPassword>
    These credentials will be used to authenticate API calls from SAP to OpenText during testing and validation.

SAP Domain Whitelisting (Trusted Origin)

  • Your SAP Service Cloud domain must be added as a trusted origin within the OpenText configuration and vice versa. This ensures secure cross-origin communication between the two platforms.

Folder & Document Structure Setup (Recommended)

  • Predefine folder structures and metadata rules in OpenText to simulate realistic document storage scenarios during integration testing. This helps ensure documents are correctly categorized, archived, and retrieved within SAP Service Cloud V2.

Step 1: Configure the Open Text mashup 

  1. Log in to SAP Service Cloud.
  2. Click on the user icon (top-right corner) and select Settings.
  3. Navigate to All Settings ‚Üí Extensibility ‚Üí Mashup Authoring.
  4. Add the Mashup

Step 2: Adjust Content Security Policies

To ensure the CloudFront domain is trusted by SAP Service Cloud:

Step 3: Add Mashup in case the End-to-End Integration

The reference document can be shared with the customer via the case email channel, allowing the process to continue seamlessly in alignment with the company's defined workflow

Integrating OpenText with SAP Service Cloud V2 provides a unified digital workspace for agents‚Äîcombining customer data, case insights, and document management in one platform. This not only boosts operational efficiency but also strengthens compliance, transparency, and customer satisfaction.

entry.title: Integrating Events from SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2 into SAP BTP Event Mesh
entry.content:
The Event Mesh capability in SAP Integration Suite helps you manage your business events. You can publish and consume events across applications using Event Mesh

SAP Event Mesh supports event-driven architectures by enabling reliable communication between distributed applications using events and messaging queues. It decouples the sending and receiving applications, allowing for greater scalability, extensibility, and resilience.

In the context of SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2, Event Mesh can be used to subscribe to business object events ‚Äî such as a service ticket creation or sales quote update ‚Äî and route them to downstream consumers like SAP BTP services, third-party APIs, or AI-based microservices.

In this blog, we‚Äôll walk through the end-to-end steps to configure and integrate SAP Event Mesh with Sales and Service Cloud V2 using SAP BTP and CAP/CPI as middleware.

 

 

üõ†Prerequisites

Before you start, ensure:

  • Access to SAP BTP (Business Technology Platform) with:
    • SAP Event Mesh service entitlement
    • SAP Integration Suite / CAP Runtime
  • Access to SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2 (Autoflow) with proper admin permissions
  • Knowledge of:
    • Basics of Event Mesh
    • Handling OAuth tokens
    • Service Key consumption via REST/CPI/CAP

üß© Step 1: Create and Configure Event Mesh Instance

  1. Login to BTP Cockpit.
  2. Navigate to your Subaccount > Instances and Subscriptions.
  3. Click Create > Instance and choose:
    • Service: event-mesh
    • Plan: default

 

  1. Provide a name (e.g., event-mesh-salesv2) and click Create.
  2. After creation, go to the instance and create a service key. Note the credentials (clientid, clientsecret, tokenurl, messaging, etc.).

 

üîêStep 2: Create and Configure Messaging Queue & Topic

  1. Go to Event Mesh UI via the subscribed application tile.
  2. Go to Queues:
    • Create a new queue (e.g., salesv2/quotecreated)
  3. Go to Topics:
    • Add topic (e.g., salesv2/order/*)
  4. Bind it to the queue.

üîóStep 3: Enable Outbound Events in Sales and Service Cloud V2

  1. In the SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2 admin console:

    • Navigate tor Extensibility Settings  or Autoflow

  2. Create or update an Communication System .

  3. Under the Outbound Events tab or Autoflow:

  • Add a new Event Topic like salesv2/order/created
  • Provide Webhook URL or Messaging Endpoint pointing to Event Mesh
  • Use OAuth2 Client Credentials (from the Event Mesh service key)

  1. Activate the arrangement.

‚úÖThis ensures that every new order created in V2 will emit an event to Event Mesh.

Autoflow

External Hooks

‚öôÔ∏èStep 4: Consume Events (Using SAP CPI or CAP)

Option A: SAP CPI (Cloud Integration)

  1. In SAP Integration Suite:

  • Create an iFlow with an AMQP receiver adapter configured with Event Mesh credentials.
  • Subscribe to the topic salesv2/order/created
  • Use a JSON/XML message converter to map incoming payloads.
  • Route to your target system (e.g., S/4HANA, SAP Build App, external API)
  • Here we are not routing just checking payload

Send message to the queue

The above CPI is built with below below details.

Open a new tab in the Postman.

  • Build the postman URL as below https://<uri of the rest protocol based section from Service Keys>/messagingrest/v1/queues/<Queue name>/messages. Queue name is queue name along with the namespace. Replace the / present in the namespace with %2fwhile executing.

  • Open the Headers tab add below two key-value pairs.

    KEY VALUE
    x-qos0 or 1
    authorizationBearer <the retrieved access_token >
     

     
  • Open the Authorization tab and select the TYPE as No Auth.
 

  • Open the Body tab and select the type as raw. And enter some test message in the body.

  • Select the POST option in Postman and click on the Send button. If sending message is successful, you shall get a status as 204 No Content.

 

üîçStep 5: Test the End-to-End Flow

  1. Create a Sales Quote in Sales Cloud V2.

  2. Check:

  • Event is visible in Event Mesh Monitor
  • Message is consumed by your CPI or CAP app and we can observe the payload
  • Expected outcome is triggered (e.g., S/4HANA update, email, dashboard refresh)

V2

CPI

‚úÖConclusion

Integrating SAP Event Mesh with Sales and Service Cloud V2 unlocks powerful, real-time, event-driven capabilities. Whether you're using CPI, CAP, or external services, this setup allows scalable and decoupled architectures that respond instantly to business events.

entry.title: Custom KPI Cards in SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2, SAP Enterprise Service Management
entry.content:
Custom KPI cards can be integrated into the home page to provide a comprehensive overview of performance across various business areas. To help users track performance at a glance, the system allows administrators to add and configure KPI cards directly on the home page.

These cards pull real-time data from various applications, offering a personalized view of what's most important for your role or team.

Currently this is offered with restricted access, and to enable this feature, create a case with the CEC-CRM-PM-PF component using the subject Enable Creation of KPI Cards.

 

Link for SAP Help Portal for step-by-step details for configuration‚Äî Create KPI Cards

Demo video:

https://sapvideo.cfapps.eu10-004.hana.ondemand.com/?entry_id=1_y19tpda8

Key Features:

  • KPI cards display real-time data, ensuring users have the latest information.
  • Users can customise the appearance, metrics, and context of the KPI cards.
  • The feature allows users to drill down into the data for more detailed analysis.
  • The Home Page supports both standard pre-delivered KPI cards and custom KPI cards created by users.

Note:

  • This is the very early version that allows you to generate KPI cards on limited entities.
  • Many other entities are adopting this feature and soon will be available for configuring.
  • The feature is under continuous improvement and will be GA soon.

Conclusion:

By leveraging custom KPI cards, sales and service teams can gain valuable insights into their performance, track key metrics, and make data-driven decisions.
